# l09


## 1

```markdown
E_x = (a^2 - b^2)x + (a + c)by
E_y = (a + c)by - (c^2 + b^2)y

E_x = 0 & E_y = 0 => x = y = 0

E_x = a^2 + b_i
E_y = (a + c)b
E_y = b^2 + c^2 (in fact 4)

2 x 2 x 2 = 8 max solutions

6.866 10/07

So how do we solve the ODEs.
we take steps of same length which gives a
constraint on S. (either on the image or in the world)
We prefer to take same length in the world
but of course, it's harder.
Another idea is to take equal steps in height (dz/ds = 1)
or equal change in brightness in the image (dI/ds = 1) so we step
from isophote to isophote (instead of contour to contour).

Consistency of solution
We might end up with crossing strips which happens if the image is noisy.
A solution is to solve the strips in parallel and check consistency.
```

## 2

```markdown
Also strips may spread out and we want to create new ones,
so again, it is important not to solve independently.

Now: from a new step, we have a new initial curve, so you can
improve the solution as you go. And this can help solve
ambiguities.

## 3

```markdown
You can have more sophisticated algorithms to get binary images.
Binarizing may be extracted from sensors: depth, contrast.

Size? → area

Position? → centroid; center of the bounding box
find minimum inertia axis
\[ I = \sum_{i=1}^{N} m_i r_i^2 \]

"partial pixel" effect

Orientation? Bounding box doesn't work well
but - least square line fit
\[ \iint x^2 b(x, y) \, dx \, dy \]

Line: \( x \sin \theta - y \cos \theta + p = 0 \)

\[ 
\begin{cases} 
x' = x \cos \theta + y \sin \theta \\
y' = -x \sin \theta + y \cos \theta - p 
\end{cases} 
\]

\[ x_0 \sin \theta - y_0 \cos \theta + p = 0 \]

\[ \left( \frac{d}{dp} = 0 \right) \]

min \[ \rho^2 \iint y'^2 \, dx \, dy \]
